meanings.def: to start something, such as an organization or an institution, especially by providing money
examples: Her family founded the college in 1895.
the founding members of the European Union
He was a founding editor of the journal.
He founded the company 20 years ago.

meanings.def: to be the first to start building and living in a town or country
examples: The town was founded by English settlers in 1790.
be founded on something Their marriage was founded on love and mutual respect.

meanings.def: to melt metal and pour it into a mould; to make objects using this process

related: get caught/found with your hand in the cookie jar
